meanings.sent1: The army capitulated to the enemy forces.
meanings.sent2: After a long battle, the soldiers capitulated and raised the white flag.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn child finally capitulated and agreed to eat his vegetables.
meanings.sent4: In the face of overwhelming evidence, the suspect capitulated and confessed to the crime.
meanings.sent5: The captain knew he had no choice but to capitulate to the stormy sea.

meanings.sent1: Realizing he was wrong, he capitulated and accepted the defeat.
meanings.sent2: The negotiator capitulated to the demands of the opposing party.
meanings.sent3: The tree finally capitulated to the strong winds and swayed in surrender.
meanings.sent4: The student capitulated to the teacher's instructions and followed them diligently.
meanings.sent5: The defeated knight had no choice but to capitulate to the victorious opponent.

meanings.sent1: Feeling exhausted, she capitulated and decided to take a break.
meanings.sent2: The explorer capitulated his quest for the lost city due to harsh conditions.
meanings.sent3: The detective finally capitulated and handed over the case to his colleague.
meanings.sent4: The athlete capitulated his dream of winning the championship after the injury.
meanings.sent5: The old warrior knew it was time to capitulate his sword and retire in peace.
